sentences.sContent: Sofia was in the bedroom tending to her son.
sentences.sCn: 索菲娅在卧室里照料她的儿子。

sentences.sContent: ...A rat or pigeon might not be the obvious choice to tend to someone who is sick...
...If a person stays in the same room the following night they tend to sleep more soundly...
...People who sleep less tend to have higher blood pressure...
...What do many people tend to think of innovation...
...What does the woman tend to do while she is on the phone...
...The article says many people tend to assume that innovation just means creating something new...
...Adults tend to talk about learning as if it were medicine: unpleasant...
...They tend to enjoy the moment when something good is happening...
...They tend to have a lot of experience themselves in the technology business...
...Chinese parents tend to focus too much on children's study...

words.tran: 温柔的；柔软的；脆弱的；幼稚的；难对付的
有偏见的，有倾向的；宣传性的
宣传性的；有支持某种立场的倾向
提供，偿还；使…变嫩；是…变柔软

trans.tranOther: to look after someone or something
